page.title: 05East Worcs Water Works
page.content: In Wildmoor there is a pumping station to pump underground water into the public water supply. When rain falls on to the ground some of it runs away into streams and rivers and some senks into the ground. In Fairfield the underlying rock is a porous sandstone so the rain sinks deep into the rock. To purify the water chlorine is added, left for half and hour and then removed by adding sulphur dioxide. This method kills any germs and removes the chlorine taste. Flouride also is added up to the recommended level. The Wildmoor pumping station and the Washingstocks pumping station are controlled by a computer so no-one needs to work there. The boreholes are 70 metres deep.
